title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox as a coach for the 2026 season.
Varitek has been with the Red Sox for nearly 30 years and played as a catcher from 1997 to 2011.
Varitek praised rookie catcher Carlos Narvaez, who batted .241 and led MLB catchers by throwing out 32 base stealers in 2025.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns in the 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams caught a 71-yard touchdown while Henderson had two rushing TDs, reaching speeds over 21 mph and 22 mph respectively.
Patriots rookie Craig Woodson recorded eight tackles, while Elijah Ponder had a crucial sack against Tampa Bay's Baker Mayfield.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads NFL MVP odds at +250 after Patriots' win over Tampa Bay, according to FanDuel.
Maye threw for 270 yards, 2 touchdowns, and 1 interception in a 28-23 victory against the Buccaneers.
Maye's season totals: 2,555 passing yards, 19 touchdowns, 5 interceptions, plus 283 rushing yards and 2 rushing touchdowns.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski to sign a one-day contract with the New England Patriots to retire as a Patriot.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with the Patriots and helped the team win three Super Bowl titles.
Gronkowski co-hosts a podcast and broadcasts NFL games for Fox Sports after retiring from football.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams stepped up, scoring critical touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
New England Patriots secured their seventh consecutive victory despite Christian Barmore's quiet performance and tight ends' limited contributions.
Quarterback Drake Maye's completion rate fell to 51%, but he connected on key deep plays, helping maintain the Patriots' winning streak.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend seven-game win streak by defeating Buccaneers 28-23 in Tampa.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored three touchdowns, contributing majorly to the Patriots' victory.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 16-of-31 throws for 270 yards with two touchdowns and one interception.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga is charged with drunk driving after crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
State Police found Daveiga's vehicle crashed at Leverett Circle; he reportedly exhibited signs of intoxication.
Officer Daveiga, who pleaded not guilty, is on modified duty and due back in court Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits remain in federal custody after an ICE raid on November 4, 2025.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports difficulty obtaining information about the detainees, who allegedly faced mistreatment, including being denied food and showers.
Tricia McLaughlin from DHS claims the workers entered the U.S. illegally, while local officials condemn the raid and support the detainees.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on November 8, 2025, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser rose to prominence after a standout performance at the 2024 Tom Brady roast and hosting the Golden Globes.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial insurance goal for the Boston Bruins in a 5-3 win over the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten, traded from Toronto last season, marked a special return to face his former team, contributing his third goal of the season.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as the game's best player, highlighting his impact since joining the Bruins lineup.
